This works great but you forgot to remove the BIN file for disk A (CD 1) after you split it up into smaller RAR files  making this download 690 megs. larger than it needs to be.

*** WARNING ***
---------------------
This 2003 SBS Standard did not take my oem COA (hard to use the posted COA number).  In addition,  this 2003 SBS has had all connections to Microsoft's websites disabled so I couldn't get to Windows Update or msn.com or any Microsoft website!  I borrowed a full OEM 2003 SBS set of disks, ran a repair install, it accepted the number from my COA label, and now I can get to all Microsoft sites and run all the updates to patch the security holes in 2003 SBS which is critical to be done before deploying my server and not get infected immediately.

BTW -  If you get the 2.7 version of the NOD32 antivirus it is still installable on the server versions of Windows (at least 2000 and 2003) and after running the fix and registry patch keep manually trying to update, eventually it will connect to one of the Eset servers and update ok.

***  WARNING #2 ***
-------------------------

I just finished the NOD32 v2.7 AV update and it immediately popped up with the CONFICKER.AA worm in C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\ODUPKW.DLL.   I don't know if this was already in this SBS download or it came from the fact I was connected 1/2 day without being able to update the OS and NOD32 refused to update but "BE AFRAID, BE VERY AFRAID!" of this 2003 SBS until you can figure out how to remove the disabled Microsoft update and can get NOD32 to update successfully.
Conficker worm in all forms (A, B, or C) is nasty stuff.
